Uses of Interface
gameEngine.Drawable

  • Packages that use Drawable 
    Package Description
    gameEngine  
    levelPieces  

    • Uses of Drawable in gameEngine

      Subinterfaces of Drawable in gameEngine 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Moveable
      Moveable extends Drawable because ALL pieces must be able to be shown.
      Classes in gameEngine that implement Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Player
      Keeps track of player status (location, hit points, etc.) Manages player movement.
      Methods in gameEngine with parameters of type Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Player.doMove(Drawable[] gameBoard)
      Get the players move, and move him
      void Moveable.move(Drawable[] gameBoard, int playerLocation)
      move takes the list of pieces and the player's location and updates the list of pieces (i.e., moves this piece to a new location).

    • Uses of Drawable in levelPieces

      Classes in levelPieces that implement Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GamePiece 
      class  Gargoyle 
      class  Ghost
      Ghost Piece Class
      class  Gnome
      Gnome Piece Class
      class  Phoenix 
      class  Unicorn
      Unicorn Piece Class
      class  Werewolf
      Ghost Piece Class
      Methods in levelPieces that return Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Drawable[] LevelEngine.getBoard()
      Returns the gameBoard, which is an array of Drawable
      Methods in levelPieces with parameters of type Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InteractionResult Werewolf.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Interacts with player piece Werewolf will cause a Kill
      InteractionResult Unicorn.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Interacts with player piece Unicorn will cause an advance
      InteractionResult Phoenix.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Interacts with player piece Phoenix will cause a get_point
      InteractionResult Ghost.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Interacts with player piece Ghost will cause a hit
      InteractionResult Gargoyle.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Interacts with player piece Gargoyle will cause a get_point
      abstract InteractionResult GamePiece.interact(Drawable[] pieces, int playerLocation)
      Abstract classes should have at least one abstract method
      void Unicorn.move(Drawable[] gameBoard, int playerLocation)
      Moves the Unicorn symbol on the board Moves to the right 3 on every turn
      void Ghost.move(Drawable[] gameBoard, int playerLocation)
      Moves the Ghost symbol on the board Moves randomly on the board
